pr_title: Add some PostgreSQL compatibility features mentioned in issue #2450

timeline.bodyText: This code should be used only in PostgreSQL compatibility mode.
timeline.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText: And even in the PostgreSQL compatibility mode this code should not break SET SESSION CHARACTERISTICS …, this command is a part of the SQL Standard and it is supported by PostgreSQL too.
replies.author: katzyn

timeline.bodyText: This code too, we already have too many non-standard stuff that is incorrectly accepted in all compatibility modes.
timeline.author: katzyn

timeline.bodyText:
Don't use Value.getObject() in functions, objects returned by it aren't required to return something useful from their toString() methods.
For this specific function getString() is a more reasonable method.
This function also needs some tests.
timeline.author: katzyn

timeline.bodyText:
This expression has declared type INTEGER and may return only ValueNull.INSTANCE and instances of ValueInteger.
You can use convertToInt(null), but most likely the 32-bit unsigned values need special handling here to avoid NUMERIC_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE_2 error.
timeline.author: katzyn

replies.author: auntyellow

timeline.bodyText: You need to convert the type to Value.ARRAY first with v0.convertTo(TypeInfo.TYPE_ARRAY) or something like it.
timeline.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText: array_to_string is removed from this PR
replies.author: auntyellow
